section_videos.video_description: Introduction to this subscription series.
Set and achieve your musical goals: use a notebook!

Explore Guitar Wisdom. The easiest way is to click BROWSE, then "View all" and "Show more" to see each playlist/category in its entirety.
If you are a beginner, we recommend that you start with the Beginner Series and the Sight-Reading Series. Both of these Series are arranged sequentially, so that you can follow an established path at the outset.
Guitarists with some playing experience may want to jump into the Foundation & Technique series and Music Theory I. These lessons are  linear/sequential at the beginning, but they transition to topical lessons.
The lessons on Blues, Jazz, Funk, R&B and Improvisation are topical. They are not meant to be followed in any strict order.

There are many paths to wisdom! The most important thing is to find the one that is right for you! 
If you are a subscriber, and you need some ideas for creating your own path here, please check out Tomo's video on "How to Learn with Guitar Wisdom" (QAP02) in the Q&A/Proficiency section.

section_videos.video_title: B1 Open Chord - E minor, Guitar Basics, Picking, Strumming
section_videos.video_description: Your first open chord: E minor. Learn a simple, open chord. Learn the notes of the open strings. Learn the proper way to hold your pick. Learn rhythm basics and strum in 4/4 time: whole notes, half notes and quarter notes. Guitar: Harmony acoustic with pickup. BOSS Katana 50 amp. D’Addario Strings. Pickboy 1 mm TF Signature.

section_videos.video_title: B2 Open Chord - D - Arpeggio - Alternate Picking
section_videos.video_description: Learn the triangle-shaped open D chord on Strings 4 3 2 1. In 4/4 time, strum the D chord or play an arpeggio. Learn to pick with downward and upward strokes. Learn to use alternate picking, when playing eighth notes. Guitar: Harmony acoustic with pickup. BOSS Katana 50 amp. D’Addario Strings. Pickboy 1 mm TF Signature.

section_videos.video_title: B3 Open Chord - C - Strumming Patterns
section_videos.video_description: Learn to play the open C chord on Strings 5 4 3 2 1. Learn four strumming patterns in 4/4 time. Learn Tomo’s thumb muting technique. Guitar: Harmony acoustic with pickup. BOSS Katana 50 amp. D’Addario Strings. Pickboy 1 mm TF Signature.

section_videos.video_title: B4 Open Chord - G - Strumming Patterns
section_videos.video_description: Learn to play the open G chord – six strings. Learn and practice several strumming patterns. Learn to strum with your thumb or your first finger. Combine the G chord with other chords while strumming in various patterns. Guitar: Orangewood Ava Mahogany Live. D’Addario Strings.

section_videos.video_title: B5 Open Chord - A - Fingerpicking - Combine Chords
section_videos.video_description: Learn to play the open A Chord – five strings. Learn fingerpicking and practice with triads. Combine the A chord with other chords while fingerpicking in various patterns. Guitar:  Orangewood Ava Mahogany Live. D’Addario Strings.

section_videos.video_title: B6 Open Chords - E A Em Am - Strumming - Muting
section_videos.video_description: Learn to play the Open E Chord – six strings. Learn to combine open chords: E A Em Am and others. Practice thumb muting and learn palm muting. Focus on Rhythm/Tapping. Strum in Quarter, Eighth and Sixteenth Notes with thumb or first finger. Guitar: Orangewood Ava Mahogany Live. D’Addario Strings.

section_videos.video_title: B7 Open Chords G E- C D Strumming Rhythm Tapping
section_videos.video_description: Open Chords: Learn to play G E- C D in a “Songwriter” or “Pop” Style. (Note to beginners: the “top” note in a chord is the note with the highest pitch.) Learn to combine these chords and strum them with a sixteenth-note feel. Focus on rhythm with tapping exercises. Guitar: Orangewood Ava Mahogany Live. D’Addario Strings. Pickboy TF Signature.

section_videos.video_title: B8 Open Chords - 7 Progressions with 3 or 4 Chords
section_videos.video_description: Playing 7 Progressions with 3 or 4 Chords. Learn to play different progressions with the Songwriter- Style chords from the preceding lesson, and understand how different progressions change the mood and feel of the music. Tomo’s 5-progressions playing demo will help you to focus on listening and ear training. Guitar: Orangewood Ava Mahogany Live. D’Addario Strings. Pickboy TF Signature.

section_videos.video_title: B9 Open Chords - Songwriter Chords - A, B, C Sections - Strumming, Muting
section_videos.video_description: Open Chords. Songwriter Chords. Playing a “song” with A, B and C Sections. Strumming Technique. Muting Technique. Guitar: Gibson J-45. D’Addario Strings. Pickboy TF Signature.

section_videos.video_title: B10 Open Chords - Strumming, Counting, Words of Wisdom
section_videos.video_description:
Open Chords: Strumming and Counting. Sub-dividing the count: 1&2&3&4&. Strumming down on the 1, 2, 3, 4 and strumming up on the &. Advice for guitarists. Guitar: Orangewood Ava Mahogany Live. D’Addario Strings. Pickboy TF Signature. Pickboy Tomo Fujita Wisdom Picks. 
NOTE: if you are not already familiar with the Songwriter Chords in this lesson, please study Beginner Series lessons B7, B8 and B9.

Open Chords: Songwriter Chords - Fingerpicking and Arpeggios. Three fingerpicking patterns. Guitar: Orangewood Ava Mahogany Live. D’Addario Strings.
NOTE: If you are not already familiar with the Songwriter Chords in this lesson, please study Beginner Series lessons B7, B8 and B9.

Following Chords with Triads. (See chords in Lesson B12.) Learning to follow chords with Triads will provide a solid foundation for improvisation. Guitar: Orangewood Ava Mahogany Live. D’Addario Strings. Pickboy TF Signature.
Rhythm – Sixteenth Notes Tapping. Learning/Practicing Rhythm and Accents. Tomo's Philosophy: Pickboy TF Wisdom Picks.

Rhythm – Picking. Picking exercises: nine examples. Alternate picking, 8th notes, 16th notes, triplets, rhythm exercises, rhythm training, foundational rhythm skills. Guitar: Orangewood Ava Mahogany Live. D’Addario Strings. Pickboy TF Signature.

For more information, follow up with Guitar Wisdom videos covering C Major Scale, Triads, Diatonic Triads. Guitar: Orangewood Ava Mahogany Live. D’Addario Strings. Pickboy TF Signature.

Introduction to the Guitar Wisdom Sight-Reading Series. To follow these lessons, you will need to buy a copy of "A Modern Method for Guitar, Volume 1" by William G. Leavitt, former Chair of the Guitar Department at Berklee College of Music. The book is available at berkleepress.com and elsewhere. In this first lesson of the Series, Tomo guides you through Pages 3 - 5, Exercises 1, 2, 3 and 4, with special attention to muting technique. Guitar: Gibson J-45. D’Addario Strings. Pickboy TF Signature.

section_videos.video_title: SR88 Leavitt One Page 120 - Major Scales 4th Position
section_videos.video_description: Bill Leavitt, Volume 1, Page 120. Major Scales in 4th Position. A Major and E Major. Palm muting and left-hand muting. Guitar: Orangewood Ava Mahogany Live. D’Addario XT (.012-.053) Strings. Pickboy TF Signature Picks.
Learning the elements of a Major scale, starting with C Major: degree, whole step and half step, and some attention to intervals and triads.
Learning the notes in the G Major Scale and the F Major Scale, using what we learned in the preceding lesson.
Understanding the Roman Numeral system. What does I IV V mean, in C Major and G Major?
D Major & D Dorian. Learning the notes in the D Major Scale. Learning D Dorian (by note and degree) and understanding its relationship to C Major.
Learn the notes and degrees of G Mixolydian and C Mixolydian, understand their relationship to C Major, and play over a two-chord (I IV) vamp.
Learn the Aeolian mode/scale (natural minor scale) by note and degree, understand the relationship between A Aeolian and C Major, and play over chord changes.

Learn the Lydian mode/scale and play over chord changes in several keys. Gear: Ibanez AZ 2204 Custom, Air Straps guitar strap, Fender Pro Reverb (2), Lehle P-Split high-impedance signal splitter, D’Addario Strings, Pickboy 1 mm TF Signature, BOSS RC-1 Loop Station.

Phrygian mode/scale. Play a melody over chord changes, and discover the three other modes/scales that are played in melodic soloing over a four-chord progression. Gibson (1967) ES-335. Lehle P-Split High-Impedance Signal Splitter. Two Fender Pro Reverb Amps. BOSS RC-1 Loop Station. D’Addario Strings. Pickboy 1 mm TF Signature Pick.

Major Pentatonic Scale. Learn the C Major Pentatonic (5-tone) scale by note and degree, understand its relationship to the C Major scale, and mix in a bit of Ear Training. Gibson (1967) ES-335. Lehle P-Split. 2 Fender Pro Reverb Amps. D’Addario Strings. Pickboy 1 mm TF Signature Pick.

Minor Pentatonic Scales. Learn the A minor pentatonic scale, by note and degree, and understand its relationship to the A minor scale. Learn the C minor pentatonic scale, by note and degree. Gibson (1967) ES-335. Lehle P-Split. 2 Fender Pro Reverb Amps. D’Addario Strings. Pickboy 1 mm TF Signature Pick. BOSS RC-1 Loop Station.

Minor triads. Learn the relationship between major and minor triads. Learn C minor triads and F minor triads. Play the chord changes of a famous tune, using only triads. Improvise by following the triads. Gibson 2002 Les Paul R9. Lehle P-Split. Fender Pro Reverb Amps (2). D’Addario Strings. Pickboy 1 mm TF Signature Pick.

Learn diatonic triads in C Major. Then learn these triads in Bb Major, F Major and G Major. Once you are comfortable with the first two segments of this lesson, learn to use diatonic triads when improvising in D Dorian and G Mixolydian. Ibanez AZ 2204 Custom. Lehle P-Split High-Impedance Signal Splitter. Fender Pro Reverb Amps (2). D’Addario Strings. Pickboy 1 mm TF Signature. BOSS RC-1 Loop Station.

Four-Note 7th Chords: Diatonic 7th Chords. Learn to play diatonic 7th chords in C Major, Bb Major, G Major and F Major. Guitar: Gibson 2002 Les Paul R9. Lehle P-Split High Impedance Signal Splitter. Fender Pro Reverb Amps (2). D’Addario Strings. Pickboy 1 mm TF Signature. BOSS RC-1 Loop Station.

Locrian Mode. Learn the Locrian scale/mode by degree, and play over a backing track. Guitar: Kanji TF Signature. Lehle P-Split High Impedance Signal Splitter. Fender Pro Reverb Amps (2). D’Addario Strings. Pickboy 1 mm TF Signature Pick. BOSS RC-3 Loop Station.

Harmonic Minor. Learn the Harmonic minor scale by degree, and understand the sound and feel as Tomo plays over ii V i backing tracks in A minor and D minor.  Guitar: Kanji TF Signature. Lehle P-Split High-Impedance Signal Splitter. Fender Pro Reverb Amps (2). D’Addario Strings. Pickboy 1 mm TF Signature Pick. BOSS RC-3 Loop Station.

Melodic Minor. Learn the Melodic minor scale by degree, and understand the sound and feel as Tomo plays over two backing tracks. Kanji TF Signature. Lehle P-Split High-Impedance Signal Splitter. Fender Pro Reverb Amps (2). D’Addario Strings. Pickboy 1 mm TF Signature Pick. BOSS RC-3 Loop Station.

Learn the Lydian b7 scale, also known as Mixolydian #11, the 4th mode of the melodic minor scale, by degree, and the sound and feel of this scale over chord changes. Learn to hear/recognize the elements of this scale in "Crossing" by Tomo Fujita. Guitar: Kanji TF Signature. Lehle P-Split High-Impedance Signal Splitter. Fender Pro Reverb Amps (2). D’Addario Strings. Pickboy 1 mm TF Signature Pick. BOSS RC-3 Loop Station.

Altered Scale, also known as Super Locrian, the 7th mode of the melodic minor scale: learn this scale by degree, and its sound and feel over chord changes. Guitar: Kanji TF Signature. Lehle P-Split High-Impedance Signal Splitter. Fender Pro Reverb Amps (2). D’Addario Strings. Pickboy 1 mm TF Signature Pick. BOSS RC-3 Loop Station.

Learn the Mixolydian (b9) (b13) scale, also known as Phrygian Dominant, the 5th mode of the harmonic minor scale, by degree, and learn the sound and feel over chord changes. Guitar: Kanji TF Signature. Lehle P-Split High-Impedance Signal Splitter. Fender Pro Reverb (2). D’Addario Strings. Pickboy 1 mm TF Signature. BOSS RC-3 Loop Station.

Learn the Whole Tone Scale, as well as the sound and feel of this scale over bluesy chord changes and a funky groove. When learning from this and all other Guitar Wisdom videos, please remember that the "bottom" note in a chord is the note with the lowest pitch, and the "top" note is the one with the highest pitch. Guitar: Ibanez AZ Custom. Lehle P-Split High-Impedance Signal Splitter. Fender Pro Reverb Amps (2). D’Addario Strings. Pickboy 1 mm TF Signature. BOSS RC-3 Loop Station through BOSS Katana 50.

Learn the Diminished Scale, together with the sound and feel of this scale over chord changes. Ibanez AZ Custom. Lehle P-Split. Fender Pro Reverb Amps (2). D’Addario Strings. Pickboy 1 mm TF Signature. BOSS RC-3 Loop Station with BOSS Katana 50 Amp.

Learn Diminished 7th Arpeggios by degree, sound and feel. Learn how to apply them in a jazzy A Blues musical example. Ibanez AZ Custom. Lehle P-Split. Fender Pro Reverb Amps (2). D’Addario Strings. Pickboy 1 mm TF Signature. BOSS RC-3 Loop Station with BOSS Katana 50 Amp.

section_videos.video_description: Diminished Scale: Half-Step, Whole Step (also known as Symmetric Diminished). Learn this scale by degree, sound and feel. Learn how to apply it in a Funky Groove musical example. Guitar: Ibanez AZ Custom. Lehle P-Split. Fender Pro Reverb Amps (2). D’Addario Strings. Pickboy 1 mm TF Signature. BOSS RC-3 Loop Station with BOSS Katana 50 Amp.

Learn diminished triads by degree, sound and feel, understanding the relationship between minor triads and diminished triads. Learn how to apply diminished triads in a musical example. Guitar: Ibanez AZ Custom. Lehle P-Split. Fender Pro Reverb Amps (2). D’Addario Strings. Pickboy 1 mm TF Signature. BOSS RC-3 Loop Station with BOSS Katana 50 Amp.

Fender Pro Reverb (2). Lehle P-Split. Providence E205TF Cables. One Control Prussian Blue Reverb. Pickboy TF Signature.
Triads: I IV and I ii- Triads, Key of A. Guitar: Ibanez AZ2204N. Fender Pro Reverb (2). Lehle P-Split. D’Addario EXL110 (.010 - .046) Strings. Providence E205TF Cables. Pickboy TF Signature.

D’Addario EXL110 (.010-.046) Strings. Fender Musicmaster Bass Amp. Providence E205TF Cables. Pickboy TF Signature.
Practice Tips: Fingering Exercises, including Crazy Chromatics. Guitar: Kanji Hard Tail. Fender Pro Reverb (2). D’Addario Strings. Pickboy TF Signature.

String Bending Practice Tips. Guitar: Kanji Hard Tail. Amp: Tweed Champ by StewMac. Vintage Tubes (special thanks to Keith, a subscriber) JAN6V6GTY dated !2/1969 and JAN12AX7WA dated 3/1975. D’Addario Strings EXL110 (.010 - .046). Pickboy TF Signature.

How to add tasteful vibrato to your string bending. Major scale, Major pentatonic scale, and melodic phrasing . . . think of John Mayer or Jerry Garcia. Guitar: PRS Silver Sky (John Mayer Signature), Fender Pro Reverb (2), Lehle P-Split, D’Addario XS (.010-.046) Strings, Providence E205TF Cables, Vemuram Jan Ray for TF, BOSS RC-3 Loop Station, Pickboy TF Signature.

Focus on Rhythm. This Lesson will be especially helpful to players who struggle with Sixteenth Notes, Alternate Picking, and Playing a Funk Groove. No guitar in this lesson!

D’Addario XS (.010-.046) Strings. Clay Jones overdrive pedal. BOSS RC-3 Loop Station. Providence E205TF Cables. Pickboy TF Signature.
